reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent 3 nights here in mid-May. The B&B is small enough to provide a uniquely personal experience. Fiona (the owner) keeps a spotless place and cooks lovely breakfasts each morning. The views from Avoncraig can't be beat since it overlooks the entire town and is across the street from McCaig's Tower. The entire community is walkable. We enjoyed sitting in the common room talking with Fiona a couple of evenings and look forward to returning to Oban and Avoncraig someday soon. Though this time, it will be for a different purpose. . .to visit not just the town, but our new friend, Fiona.
reviews.title: One of our favorite experiences

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This lovely B&B overlooks McCaigs tower in Oban and is situated just behind the tower. Ample parking and a very friendly welcome awaited us.
reviews.title: Comfortable B&B with superb views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front bedroom has superb views over the bay to the Islands. Very comfortable rooms, Freesat TV m tea and coffee making in the room, superbly appointed and very new bathroom. shower - essentially the front bedroom is like a mini suite. It is up the hill but a brisk 10 minute walk and you are down on the harbour front where there are ample restaurants and bars.
reviews.title: Clean and cozy room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was excellent - full Scottish Breakfast ( Egg/Bacon/Sausage/ Black Pudding/ Eggs/ Tomato/ Mushroom/ Potato cake) with fruit juice/ tea/coffee/ cereals/ yoghurt/ toast/ oatcakes and brilliant home made jams and compote. We had a 300 mile drive after this and it kept us going all the way home.
reviews.title: Don't hesitate to stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Highly recommended and we will certainly look to stay there again when we are next in Oban.
reviews.title: Avoncraig B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: The room was first class, the bed was really comfy. The view from the B+B is spectacular. Breakfast was lovely, cannot fault at all and will definitely be back when I am in Oban. It is a really quiet location away from the town centre but still only a 5 mins walk away.
reviews.title: First Class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Me alojé aquí con mi hermana y me encantó este B&B. La habitación era increíble con lavabo incluído. Parecía un hotel de lujo. Nos sentimos como en casa
reviews.title: Genial / Great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I steyed here with my sister an we loved this B&B. The en-suite room was amazing. It look like a luxury hotel. We felt like home.
reviews.title: A lovely little B & B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Avoncraig is a small B&B situated on the hilltop next to McCaigs Tower overlooking beautiful Oban harbour. We enjoyed starting our day in the breakfast room taking in the view, and more often than not, brilliant rainbows over the harbour. Our host Fiona made us so welcome and prepared lovely breakfasts during our four night stay. The bedroom and ensuite bathroom were very clean and serviced daily. The bed was comfy and accommodation warm & cosy. Recommended.
reviews.title: Avoncraig B & B - Superb!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you Fiona for you hospitality
reviews.title: Avoncraig B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cannot praise this little gem of a Bed & Breakfast highly enough. On a wonderful location looking down onto the Harbour with a very discreet and professional hostess, the Avoncraig is an excellent choice. The breakfast is top quality and the rooms are well-appointed and modern with internet connection and large bathroom. Plenty of tourist info is available as well as restaurants nearby (good quality too!). Well done Fiona in creating such a place! I would heartily recommend this to others.
reviews.title: A wonderful B&B!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We spent six nights at Avoncraig and can highly recommend this B&B. Fiona is a wonderful host, very generous and friendly. The room was perfectly clean, the breakfast phantastic and the view from the breakfast room to the harbour unique. Just a perfect stay! Thank you, Fiona, for everything!
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Brigitte and Dietmar from Austria
reviews.title: A special place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A special b&b experience. My wife and I and our 18 yr old daughter stayed here for two nights 7 and 8 July. Fiona is a lovely and meticulous person who calmly makes sure everything is perfect. She kindly gave our daughter a separate room and was happy to accommodate our request for a modest breakfast (since we were not fully acclimatised to the enormous size of early morning meals in Scotland!). Oban is a beautiful place and the view from the breakfast room at Avoncraig is majestic. We had a great time wandering around the town, eating the local seafood, visiting the distillery and tackling the pictoresque and precipitous local golf course (bring a separate trolley full of golf balls for that one!). Walking or driving up and down to and from Avoncraig is a great experience in itself. And the town even had friendly bikies my wife could gently make fun of (not something you'd try in Australia!) Thanks Fiona.
reviews.title: Not long enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just read a bunch of the reviews. I think they all encompass my feeling about Avoncraig. Wish we could have stayed longer. Hospitality here with Fiona and Stuart is second to none. Fiona was very generous supplying plates and glasses etc so my wife and I could eat our supper of crackers and cheeses we had brought. My wife couldn't get over the water taps turning colours for hot and cold. Sorry Stuart, I didn't know my wife was going to sample my small bottle of scotch. Thanks again for reviewing my family tree. You saved me time not having to go to Lesmahagow to find out if there was a familial connection to a well known Canadian songwriter
reviews.title: A little hard to get to, but worth the view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013
reviews.text: Three of us have just spent three days at this B&B which has been delightful. The highlight was the packed breakfast/lunch provided when we had an early tour to the Puffins. Great position overlooking the town and very reasonably priced. Couldn't have been more helpful.
reviews.title: Great views fantastic service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013
reviews.text: We travelled to Oban on our way to Tobermory and I wish we had stayed at Avoncraig for longer that just the one night. The rooms were extremely clean and well decorated. Fiona was so warm and welcoming. It is only a 5 minute walk from the high street and there are superb views of Oban. Can't wait to go back.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for one night on 7th June. A lovely bed and breakfast in a very peaceful location with ample parking. The room was immaculate and very comfortable and the bathroom was spotless. Fiona was very helpful and provided us with a list of local eateries and it was only a very short walk into the town centre. We opted for the cooked breakfast, which was lovely, there was also a great selection of cereals and fruit juices, The breakfast room had a lovely view over the town.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a lovely place wish we could have stayed longer. Fiona could not have done more for us. Loved Basil as well. Lovely views. Lovely breakfast porridge was delicious. Plenty of selection. Would love to come back one day and stay longer
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely B&B which has amazing views over the bay (from front bedroom). Fiona is extremely friendly and keeps the place spotlessly clean. Breakfast is delicious and just about everything is homemade. It is a short (if steep) walk into Oban town centre and so ideally placed for all local amenities. When comparing B&B prices in Oban, Avoncraig offers exceptional value for money!!!!!
reviews.title: Amazing value for money!!!!
